content: finished size approx 14 5 cm tall from feet to the top of the head rhino baby yarn a 1/4 x 50g ball 4-ply/ fingering weight alpaca or merino yarn in grey i used drops alpaca shade 0517 medium grey b 1/4 x 50g ball 4-ply/ fingering weight alpaca or merino yarn in light-grey i used drops sky listed as dk but knits like a 4-ply shade 02 pearl grey knitting needles pair of 3 5mm/ us 4 straight knitting needles plus a 3 5 mm short circular needle not for knitting with just for holding stitches see page 9 gauge 12 stitches and 14 row over 5cm with 3 50mm needles and yarn a extras pair amber or blue 4 5mm toy safety eyes with metal or plastic backings or sew on loops toy filling i use un-carded fibre filling 2 pairs locking type stitch markers see colour guide on page 2 yarn sewing needle pair of medium-large safety pin for holding stitches when not in use yarn can be bought from here knittedhome com hyperlink plastic- backed safety eyes can be bought from here etsy hyperlink sew-on eyes can be bought from here etsy hyperlink note this pattern does not include the sweater - for that pattern please follow the hyperlinks and use a yarn similar in weight and gauge to the yarn you ve knitted the baby rhino in etsy sweater pattern hyperlink © knitting pattern by claire garland aka dot pebbles ravelry sweater pattern hyperlink baby rhino page 2 baby rhino page 3 pattern note use cable cast-on throughout special instructions w+tk bring working yarn to the front of the work slip next stitch purl- coloured marker guide wise onto the rh needle take working yarn to the back slip the slipped this guide is here to pull out and use together with the pattern should stitch back onto the lh needle turn the knitting = w+tk wrap and turn to wish to use similar coloured guides to mine for ease of following knit especially at the making-up stage w+tp take working yarn to the back of the work slip next stitch knit- head & body wise onto the rh needle bring working yarn to the front slip the slipped orange neck stitch back onto the lh needle turn the knitting = w+tp wrap and turn green thigh purl pink lower belly light turquoise belly general abbreviations k = knit p = purl increase = increase decrease = decrease k2tog/ k3tog = knit two together/ knit three together p2tog/ p3tog = purl two together/ purl three together rh/lh = right hand/ left hand rs/ws = right side/ wrong side st/ sts =stitch/ stitches skpo = slip one stitch knit next stitch pass slipped stitch over knit stitch to decrease by one stitch kfb = knit into front then into back of stitch to increase by one stitch pfb = purl into front then knit into back of stitch to increase by one stitch baby rhino page
